Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with large elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: to right (of first figure, only tip of foot in outline remaining, of second, lower body with feet in outline, part of cloak with red dots and black dotted hem, and of possible third, part of cloak); below, band above undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0846) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 79 (Other Accession Number)
